head.title: Holiday homes in the mountains | Interhome

content.textLeft: Craggy cliffs, tranquil mountain lakes and idyllic villages - the mountains are not only a popular destination in winter. Any time of year is perfect for enjoying the magnificent mountain panorama and recharge the batteries far away from everyday life.
content.textRight: Be it in Switzerland, Austria, France or Germany: After a long hike through the mountains there is nothing better than retiring to the comfort of your holiday house or holiday apartment where you can see out the day with a glass of wine in front of the fireplace and look forward to the next mountain adventure.

content.text: Spending time in the mountains is always a delight. Choose for example from the following options for your next active holiday.

content.title: Fresh mountain air right on the doorstep – our recommendations:

content.text:
Whichever mountain region you opt for, you’ll find that: Interhome offers a wide range of exclusive holiday houses and apartments in all four of these countries. The beauty of the mountains can be enjoyed from all angles. There is one thing that all these countries and their mountain regions have in common: a short journey time and life in tune with nature which, means a calm and relaxing stay for all. A holiday in the mountains, in the roots of the region, is more than just rest and relaxation: It's medicine for the traveller’s body and soul. Take a look at some of our holiday houses and holiday apartments in the next section.
   
Whether you're travelling as a family or as a couple. Whether there's 20 or 70 of you, whether you’re bringing a dog along or not: A traditional holiday in the mountains is many tourists choice for a relaxing stay. As well as being reasonably priced, a holiday in the mountains is perfect for people who have a particular interest in tradition and family values. Nowhere else can you spend such a down-to-earth yet luxurious holiday, but in the mountains. Enjoy your holiday amidst the roots of the region or at least get close to them.
   
As nice as new discoveries are, rediscovering the old is just as much fun and allows travellers a sense of comfort and familiarity along the way. Something that all tourists embarking on a holiday in the mountains greatly appreciate and enjoy.
   
We would be delighted to welcome you to the mountains.
